summary: Internal FBI email chain from September 2021 discussing the process for exporting and providing victim communication records related to the Epstein/Maxwell case to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO). The emails focus on identifying which Victim Specialists (VS) assisted which victims and gathering all email correspondence with victims and their attorneys.

events.title: Internal FBI discussion on victim communication records
events.description: FBI personnel discuss how to identify which Victim Specialists assisted Epstein/Maxwell case victims and gather all email correspondence with victims and their attorneys for the USAO.

events.title: Request to export Epstein folder emails
events.description: Request made to export the 'Epstein' folder from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox as a data file to provide to the USAO, which is requesting all FBI email communication with victims.

events.title: Update on export process delay
events.description: FBI Program Support Analyst notes the export process must be done on-site and indicates they were out sick, delaying completion of the request.

events.title: Sharing of Epstein case file
events.description: FBI shares a OneDrive file containing Epstein case materials, with the password provided, as part of fulfilling the USAO's request.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) requested all FBI email communication with victims and their attorneys from the Epstein/Maxwell case.
FBI maintained victim and attorney communications in a dedicated 'Epstein' folder within the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox and on a SharePoint site.
The export of the email folder for the USAO required an on-site process at the FBI, indicating security protocols for sensitive materials.
FBI personnel discussed challenges in tracking which specific Victim Specialists assisted which victims, as letters were sent to attorneys and not all victims were contacted via VNS letters.
A password-protected file named 'Epstein.pdf' was shared via OneDrive for Business, with the password 'SunSh!ne$5', as part of providing requested materials.
